sanskrit_verse:
उपेतारमुपेयं च सर्वोपायांश्च कृत्स्नशः ।
एतत्त्रयं समाश्रित्य प्रयतेतार्थसिद्धये ॥ ७.२१५॥
transliteration:
upetāramupeyaṃ ca sarvopāyāṃśca kṛtsnaśaḥ |
etattrayaṃ samāśritya prayatetārthasiddhaye || 7.215||
sph_interpretive_translation: One desiring success in purpose must fully embrace the qualified agent, the appropriate objective, and all means conducive thereto.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with qualified agency
Causation is established through intentional selection of means
Capacity-based responsibility requires full engagement of purpose and method
Restoration logic operates through completeness of instrumental alignment
Consciousness alignment manifests via deliberate integration of actor, aim, and action
executable_legal_axioms: IF an agent seeks outcome O, THEN agent MUST engage fully qualified executor E
IF objective O is declared, THEN all requisite means M must be inclusively activated
IF partial execution occurs, THEN capacity deficiency SHALL be identified without attribution of fault
IF outcome fails, THEN systemic misalignment in agent-objective-means triad SHALL be restored
IF dharma is obstructed, THEN realignment of upeta, upEya, and upAya triad SHALL occur automatically
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at highest levels, the court shall assess not individual blame but the triadic coherence of actor qualification, intended aim, and adequacy of applied means. Where failure occurs, restoration centers on recalibrating this triad rather than assigning punitive liability.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that results emerge from alignment among actor, intent, and methodology. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that outcomes follow sequentially from this triadic harmony. Responsibility is proportional to the degree of alignment achieved. There is no punitive consequence—only a call for completion of the causal structure.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate triadic audit: verify presence and integrity of upeta (qualified agent), upEya (fitting goal), and upAya (complete means)
Deploy consciousness reorientation protocol to align intention with structural capacity
Facilitate reintegration of fragmented instrumental awareness through guided completion cycles
Establish feedback loop ensuring dynamic recalibration between actor, aim, and operational resources
Activate dharmic resonance field to restore natural flow between purpose, performer, and performance
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. The triadic structure of agency, aim, and means constitutes the foundational logic of reality's self-regulation. Dharma stands restored by alignment alone. No punishment inheres; consciousness itself adjudicates and integrates.
